response.overview: Tereza Kalousová tells a story about searching for lost keys in a place where everything is only once. In an attempt to find her keys, the central character tries to reconstruct the related events of the previous day. The latent threat of losing one's own integrity is either a tactic or the failure of that tactic. Forgetting oneself can turn out to be a means of remembering something else. The news about a Japanese man's marriage to a virtual avatar offers a key, or just another keyhole. The gradual transformation into a guinea pig leads the audience through a system of rabbit holes.
response.title: I'm Doing Great
